comment: I really enjoyed taking Public Speaking from Prof. Ellison. She's not a particularly easy grader on the speeches, but she's a fair grader. The tests aren't too difficult if you take notes from the readings and do a moderate amount of studying. She's easy to communicate with and if you put some effort in, the class isn't too hard.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: She is a tough professor and picky with how exactly she wants you to do to the speeches and outlines. She reads off the PowerPoint word by word and you have to learn by yourself. I barely got an A in the class after working my butt off. I would recommend taking anyone else.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: This was her first semester teaching this public speaking class and quite frankly she was very harsh with her grading. She reads off her PowerPoints word for word. Find the book for cheap barely used it. The Manual is written by a professor so follow it completely. Avoid this teacher if you want to learn how to succeed in public speaking.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Prof. Ellison is a great person and a great professor. She genuinely cares about her students and seems to be really interested in what she teaches. Her COM class made me switch my major. She remains to this day one of my favorite professors.

Any class with her should be a guarantee for a great semester. She not only teaches communication well but also engages the class in group activities which pushes us to be more open and talk to each other. She posts the powerpoints online, which I find easier to follow than the textbook.

Total doll. I didn't make myself difficult in the class, but even when I saw her interacting with students who were she was friendly and patient. I'd almost change to being a communication major if it meant getting professors like her.

I thought this class was hard for an 1101 , but I actually enjoyed it. TEST ARE TOUGH! She will warm you the first week of class. Have to study and come to class. Gives extra credit for missing one class or less. If you want to learn, take her. Only 5 grades total , 20 % Each.

While she was engaging, her tests were hard. Studying the PowerPoints will not get you an A on the Tests. She is a really tough grader, you really have to work for this foundations class. I would not recommend if you want to keep your GPA high.

Dr. Ellison is a fun, bubbly, involved professor who truly loves to teach. She gives 3 tests and a group presentation. Study her powerpoints and you'll make A's on her tests. DO NOT PROCRASTINATE ON THE PRESENTATION!! Homework and class work are easy. Very easy A if you try. Would definitely take her again!

Very nice professor and loves what she teaches, but don't take this class if you are expecting an easy communication course. She is such a tough grader and her tests are so confusing. For a 1000 level course, I put in entirely too much effort..

This was a very fun class. She's really passionate about the material and is a really funny professor. There is a huge presentation at the end of the semester and some homework here & there. I would take her again for sure.

She's a bubbly person in a good way. Lots of enthusiasm and always prepared for her lectures. She reaches out if she notices you're struggling and offers extra credit to help boost your grade. Tests are somewhat difficult but she posts study guides that really help. Passionate teaching and a kind heart. If you need help, she's there. Just awesome!

LOVED Professor Ellison! Usually I am nervous to talk in front of crowds, but she really showed us how to communicate and interact with others. Her lectures are amazing and make you actually want to pay attention. I am so glad I had her! If I could take her again, I would. There are 3-4 tests, in class work, a presentation, and extra credit.

Fantastic teacher. Very helpful, relatable, and thoughtful of others. Provides humorous ancedotes that relate to class. Makes things enjoyable. Tests are not instant A's , but if you actually study, you'll get at least a B. Yes, you have to do a  2 minute presentation that everyone gets an A on, I think you'll live. Take her, she's awesome.

i would not recommend prof. ellison if you don't like reading or group projects. also she's not the best person to ask for help. she's a really harsh grader! extra points at the end if you only miss one day

Professor Ellison was awesome. Even though her class was three hours she made it fun by showing clips of videos and group projects. Her class is pretty straight forward if you study the powerpoints and her tests have real life examples.

Very sweet teacher! Tests are all online and are not bad. To do well on them study the powerpoints and know them. That's the test!book for HW! Attendance at end is extra credit along the other ec opportunities in class! Class weights:Test 1:20% Test2- 20% Test 3-20% Final Exam:20% which is test 4 noncumm. Presentation- 20% req. by all comm teachers

She was really nice, class is mandatory. the test are really hard but if you read every week and do your work and listen (which is hard for a college student apparently) than you can easily get a B and her test are all on computer (in class). If you can do not get her on fridays at 8 a.m. it is to early to have her for three hours straight.

Professor Ellison is really sweet and she really tries to help everyone succeed in her class. Her lectures are entertaining and she explains concepts well. It's a pretty easy class and doesn't require much work. Tests are not hard, just study her powerpoints.
